title: BCD Travel signs deal with Tripbam
text:
Thu, 10 Sep 2015 10:17 Tripbam has signed a long-term deal with BCD Travel to provide the TMC’s clients with products it claims will “improve corporate hotel programmes”.
BCD Travel said it’s making Tripbam available to clients to “drive savings” and improve traveller confidence in the rates they access through their company’s hotel programme and increase the number of hotels booked through managed channels.
Tripbam is a hotel shopping service. It allows individuals, travel manage­ment companies (TMCs) and corporates to shop across multiple hotels over several days to take advantage of rate changes.
BCD Travel is a leading TMC and was named number four in BBT’s Top 50 TMCs.
“Hotel rates change constantly; it only makes sense that we secure lower rates for our travelers whenever they become available,” said BCD Travel senior VP of strategic marketing April Bridgeman.
“However, Tripbam’s offering does much more – by steering travelers toward preferred properties and chains and even toward lower-cost comparable properties, it can unlock meaningful savings opportunities," she added.
Tripbam founder and CEO Steve Reynolds (pictured) said: “We’re excited about the opportunity to help drive better hotel program performance for BCD Travel and its corporate clients.
“BCD Travel remains a leader at implementing new technologies to enhance all components of the managed travel process. We look forward to working with BCD to move the needle on use of corporate hotel programs.”
